Incentivizing solar panel installation: The city could offer tax breaks or other financial incentives to residents who install solar panels on their homes. This would encourage more people to invest in renewable energy and reduce their carbon footprint.

Community solar projects: The city could partner with local solar companies to install large-scale solar panels in public spaces, such as parks or community centers. This would provide clean energy to the community and reduce the number of homes that need to install their own solar panels.

Solar panel education and outreach: The city could launch an education and outreach campaign to help residents understand the benefits of solar panels and how to install them. This would increase awareness and encourage more people to take action.

Solar panel rental programs: The city could partner with local solar companies to offer solar panel rental programs. This would allow residents to install solar panels on their homes without the upfront cost, and would provide a steady stream of revenue for the city.

Solar panel financing programs: The city could partner with local financial institutions to offer financing programs for solar panel installations. This would make it easier for residents to afford the upfront cost of installing solar panels and would provide a steady stream of revenue for the city.
